snippet: A proposal to create a state tax credit for donations to public schools and nonprofit scholarship funds is gathering steam and turning the archbishop of New York into something of a lobbyist.
abstract: Cardinal Timothy M Dolan, archbishop of New York, is strong proponent of proposal to create a state tax credit for donations to public schools and nonprofit scholarship funds; after blogging on topic and speaking at crowded rallies around New York in support of the proposal, Dolan is headed to Albany for one last push before the state’s April 1 budget deadline.
lead_paragraph: A proposal to create a state tax credit for donations to public schools and nonprofit scholarship funds is gathering steam and turning the archbishop of New York into something of a lobbyist.

headline.main: Cardinal Dolan to Lobby for Tax Credit That Rewards Donations to Education
headline.print_headline: Cardinal Dolan to Lobby for Tax Credit That Rewards Donations to Education
